results.title: Democracy: the role of dissent
results.brief_description: A democracy has legal channels for the redress of grievances. If these seem to fail, are other actions justified? A group of tenants are faced with this question as they demonstrate and consider a rent strike in protest against the living conditions in their apartment building.
results.description: A democracy has legal channels for the redress of grievances. If these seem to fail, are other actions justified? A group of tenants are faced with this question as they demonstrate and consider a rent strike in protest against the living conditions in their apartment building.

results.title: The Demanding sea
results.brief_description: A record of life at sea. Two old sailors discuss their lives against a background of moving ships - frigates, tramps, liners, tankers, trawlers and tugs - and the sea, in all its moods, benign, stormy and ice-bound. Conveys an awareness of what the sea means.

results.title: The Delinquent, the hipster and the square
results.creator_credit: Tim Kiley, Jack Kuney and CBS Television
results.brief_description: A study of the dynamics of youth culture as expressed in dominant youth reactions to the world; rebellion, escape and uncritical acceptance. Each reaction is examined dramatically and the significance pointed out critically, yet sympathetically, by the narrator Dr. William Kirkland, late professor of Christian Ethics, McCormick Theological Seminary. Written by Elliot Baker. Starring Warren Berlinger as the square, William Hickey as the delinquent, Pat DeSimone as the girl, Mal Throne as the poet and the Max Roach Quinter.

results.title: Delegating work
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plant Supervisors Problems”.
Illustrates the problem of a supervisor’s failure to delegate work and the serious effect on his efficiency.

results.title: The Dehumanizing city...and Hymie Schultz
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hiller, George Justin, Colombia Pictures and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Adapted from the film “The Tiger makes out” with Eli Wallach, the theme here is the modern individual in conflict with complex bureaucratic systems. Waking up one morning to the callous impersonality of big city life, Hymie Schultz, mailman, decides to fight back. Bureaucracy, however, proves more stubborn than he, and at the end of the day defeated and helpless, he retreats, one individual lost among many.

results.title: Degas
results.creator_credit: Skira-Flag Films and Universal Education and Visual Arts
results.brief_description: Degas was unique in his ability to synthesize the skill of the classic draftsman with the innovative techniques of the impressionist. His chief interest was the female figure and he never tired of painting the curve of an arm or the extension of a leg. What mattered to him was the light and shade on the human figure. Art students can learn much from his drawings, space arrangements and brilliant coloring.

results.title: Deflection output circuits
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”.
An explanation of vertical and horizontal output circuits for magnetic deflection, staring with the vertical output stages as a typical deflections amplifier. The first part pf the film shows how the sawtooth scanning current in the deflection coils corresponds to linear scanning of the electron beam; it explains oscillations and damping in the output circuit. The remainder of the film builds up the complete horizontal out-put circuit, step by step.

results.title: Defensive riding techniques
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Defensive riding is avoiding accidents by foreseeing possible dangers and taking appropriate action. Gives three short rules: firstly, try to anticipate and, therefore, avoid mistakes of other motorists; secondly, drive defensively, and heed all traffic rules and signals; thirdly, make sure you can be seen at all times.

results.title: The Defensive driver
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safe Driving”.
A father who accompanies his son on a short drive observes that his son is a safe driver who anticipates dangerous situations and drives defensively in order to avoid accidents. Father and son discuss driving hazards which require alertness and courtesy, as well as skill, on the part of drivers: overcrowded areas, complicated traffic lights, pedestrians, emergency vehicles, road signs, grade crossings, and student drivers.

results.title: Defense of peace
results.creator_credit: Andre Gillet, Marcel De Hubsch, Atlantic-Film and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: Describes the organisation and mode of work of the UN. Animated charts and maps, together with live action scenes, show how the UN machinery provides a realistic method of dealing with international problems. Introduces the General Assembly Security Council, International Court of Justice, Economic and Social council and the Trusteeship Council.
